title: Hamburger Menu
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps: When the user taps on the Hamburger menu tab from the top right nav
custom_expected:
Then the Browse Menu will open
AND the "Quick Hits", "Shop & Tickets", "Ranking & Advanced Stats", "Listen & Watch". "More Apps from the MLB", "Your Account", "Help", "About", and "MLB Privacy Settings" sections will be displayed.

title: Account Settings
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps: When the user taps on the Account icon on the top left nav
custom_expected: Then the user's Account Settings screen will open

title: Sections
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user launches the More Menu
and taps to open "Account Settings"
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the following sections:

My Account
Alerts & Notifications
Preferences
Accessibility
Audio/Video
About the MLB app

title: My Players & Teams
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and looks at the section titled "My Account"
custom_expected: Then there will be a field for "My Players & Teams"

title: My Players & Teams - Settings
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and taps to open "My Players & Teams" from the "My Account" section
custom_expected:
Then the the "Favorite Team", "Followed Players", and "Followed Teams" sections will be displayed 
and the user will be able to edit their Teams and Players preferences

title: My Players & Teams - Favorite Team Set
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user already has a Favorite Team set
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and taps to open "My Players & Teams" from the "My Account" section
custom_expected:
Then the "Favorite Teams", "Followed Players", and "Followed Teams" sections will be displayed
and the user's favorite team setting will be displayed under "Favorite Team"

title: My Teams - Favorite/Followed Teams Set
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user already has a Favorite Team and a Followed Team set
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and taps to open "My Teams" from the "My Account" section
custom_expected:
Then the team picker will open 
and the user's favorite team setting will be displayed under "Favorite Teams"
and the user's followed team setting will be displayed under "Followed Teams"

title: My Teams - Followed Team(s) Set
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user already has Followed Team(s) set
but not a Favorite Team
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and taps to open "My Teams" from the "My Account" section
custom_expected:
Then the team picker will open 
and the text "No Favorite Team selected" will be displayed under "Favorite Teams"
and the user's followed team setting will be displayed under "Followed Teams"

title: Notifications
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and looks at the section titled "Alerts & Notifications"
custom_expected: Then there will be a field for "Notifications"

title: Notifications - Settings
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and taps on "Notifications" from the "Alerts & Notifications" section
custom_expected:
Then the user's notification settings will open
and they will be able to make adjustments to their settings

title: Notifications - My Teams
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user has team(s) set to "My Teams"
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and taps on "Notifications" from the "Alerts & Notifications" section
custom_expected:
Then the user's notification settings will open
and there will be a section above the full Teams section for the user's "My Teams" settings

title: Set Home Screen Icon
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is viewing the Account Settings screen
and views the "Preferences" section
custom_expected: Then there will be an option to "Set Home Screen Icon"

title: Set Home Screen Icon - My Teams
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and has team(s) set as "My Teams"
custom_steps:
When the user is viewing the Account Settings screen
and views the "Preferences" section
and taps the option to "Set Home Screen Icon"
custom_expected: Then there will be a section above the team list for the user's My Teams settings

title: Default View
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is viewing the Account Settings screen
and views the "Preferences" section
custom_expected: Then there will be an option for "Default View"

title: Screen Appearance
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is viewing the Account Settings screen
and views the "Preferences" section
custom_expected: Then there will be an option for "Screen Appearance"

title: Screen Auto-Lock
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is viewing the Account Settings screen
and views the "Accessibility" section
custom_expected:
Then there will be a toggle for "Display Auto-Lock"
and it will be toggled off by default

title: Screen Auto-Lock ON
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the device's Auto-Lock setting is set to something other than "Never"
(Settings > Display & Brightness > Auto-Lock)
custom_steps:
When the user is viewing the "Preferences" section of the Account Settings screen
and toggles ON "Screen Auto-Lock"
and has the app open and idle for longer than the device's Auto-Lock setting
custom_expected: Then the screen will auto-lock at the given time

title: Hide Scores
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is viewing the Account Settings screen
and views the "Preferences" section
custom_expected:
Then there will be a toggle for "Hide Scores"
and it will be toggled off by default

title: Hide Scores ON
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is viewing the "Preferences" section of the Account Settings screen
and toggles ON Hide Scores
and navs to the Scoreboard
custom_expected:
Then scores from Live and Final games will not be displayed
and there will be a "Hide Scores ON" banner under the date

title: Stale Test Case --** DO NOT TEST **--
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is viewing the Account Settings screen
and views the "Preferences" section
custom_expected:
Then there will be a toggle for "Shake to Toggle"
and it will be toggled off by default

title: Shake to Toggle ON
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and Hide Scores is enabled
custom_steps:
When the user is viewing the "Preferences" section of the Account Settings screen
and toggles ON "Shake to Toggle"
and navs to the Scoreboard
and shakes the device
custom_expected:
Then the Scoreboard tab will refresh
and Hide Scores will no longer be enabled
and the user will see an announcement that Hide Scores is off

title: High Quality Streaming
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps: When the user is viewing the Audio/Video section of the Account Settings screen
custom_expected: Then there will be a line for High Quality Streaming

title: High Quality Streaming - Setting
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When a user is on the Account Settings screen
and taps on High Quality Streaming
custom_expected:
Then the user will see High Streaming Quality with
a Back button to return you to Settings
three tappable options that limit Video playback
and '..data rates may apply...' text

title: High Quality Streaming - Default (MLBALL)
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user has the MLBALL entitlement
custom_steps: When a user has opened the High Quality Streaming settings page
custom_expected:
Then "Wi-Fi Only" is the default setting
and it should have a check mark

title: High Quality Streaming - Default (Lite User)
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user has no entitlements
custom_steps: When a user has opened the High Quality Streaming settings page
custom_expected:
Then "Off" is the default setting
and it should have a check mark

title: High Quality Streaming - MLBALL - Always (WiFi)
custom_preconds: Given the user is entitled with MLBALL
custom_steps:
When the user has the Streaming Quality setting set to Always
and the user is on WiFi
and launches an MLB.TV feed
custom_expected:
Then the user should see a 60FPS video

(use Charles Proxy and filter by master_tablet60)

title: High Quality Streaming - MLBALL - Always (Cellular)
custom_preconds: Given the user is entitled with MLBALL
custom_steps:
When the user has the Streaming Quality setting set to Always
and the user is on a cellular connection
and launches an MLB.TV feed
custom_expected:
Then the user should see a 60FPS video

(use Charles Proxy and filter by master_tablet60)

title: High Quality Streaming - MLBALL - WiFi Only (WiFi)
custom_preconds: Given the user is entitled with MLBALL
custom_steps:
When the user has the Streaming Quality setting set to WiFi Only
and the user is on WiFi
and launches an MLB.TV feed
custom_expected:
Then the user should see a 60FPS video

(use Charles Proxy and filter by master_tablet60)

title: High Quality Streaming - MLBALL - WiFi Only (Cellular)
custom_preconds: Given the user is entitled with MLBALL
custom_steps:
When the user has the Streaming Quality setting set to WiFi Only
and the user is on a cellular connection
and launches an MLB.TV feed
custom_expected:
Then the user should see a 30FPS video

(use Charles Proxy and filter by master_mobile -- shouldn't see 60)

title: High Quality Streaming - MLBALL - Off
custom_preconds: Given the user is entitled with MLBALL
custom_steps:
When the user has the Streaming Quality setting set to Off
and launches an MLB.TV feed
custom_expected:
Then the user should see a 30FPS video

(use Charles Proxy and filter by master_mobile -- shouldn't see 60)

title: High Quality Streaming - No MLBALL - Always (WiFi)
custom_preconds: Given the user is not entitled with MLBALL
custom_steps:
When the user has the Streaming Quality setting set to Always
and the user is on WiFi
and launches a Free Game of the Day
custom_expected:
Then the user should see a 30FPS video

(use Charles Proxy and filter by master_mobile -- shouldn't see 60)

title: High Quality Streaming - No MLBALL - Always (Cellular)
custom_preconds: Given the user is not entitled with MLBALL
custom_steps:
When the user has the Streaming Quality setting set to Always
and the user is on a cellular connection
and launches a Free Game of the Day
custom_expected:
Then the user should see a 30FPS video

(use Charles Proxy and filter by master_mobile -- shouldn't see 60)

title: High Quality Streaming - No MLBALL - WiFi Only (WiFi)
custom_preconds: Given the user is not entitled with MLBALL
custom_steps:
When the user has the Streaming Quality setting set to Wifi Only
and the user is on WiFi
and launches a Free Game of the Day
custom_expected:
Then the user should see a 30FPS video

(use Charles Proxy and filter by master_mobile -- shouldn't see 60)

title: High Quality Streaming - No MLBALL - WiFi Only (Cellular)
custom_preconds: Given the user is not entitled with MLBALL
custom_steps:
When the user has the Streaming Quality setting set to WiFi Only
and the user is on a cellular connection
and launches a Free Game of the Day
custom_expected:
Then the user should see a 30FPS video

(use Charles Proxy and filter by master_mobile -- shouldn't see 60)

title: High Quality Streaming - No MLBALL - Off
custom_preconds: Given the user is NOT entitled with MLBALL
custom_steps:
When the user has the Streaming Quality setting set to Off
and launches a Free Game of the Day
custom_expected:
Then the user should see a 30FPS video

(use Charles Proxy and filter by master_mobile -- shouldn't see 60)

title: Autoplay Video
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is viewing the Account Settings screen
and views the "Accessibility" section
custom_expected:
Then there will be a line for Autoplay Video
and the default setting will be "Data/Wifi"

title: MLB Account
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is logged in with an MLB account
custom_steps: When the user opens the Account Settings screen
custom_expected: Then the user will see their MLB account at the top of the screen

title: MLB Account - Tapping
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is logged in with an MLB account
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and tries to tap their MLB account at the top of the screen
custom_expected: Then it will not be tappable

title: Entitlements
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is logged in with an MLB account
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and sees their MLB account at the top of the screen
custom_expected: Then the user will also see their account's entitlements next to the account

title: Entitlements - MLB.TV/MLB Audio
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is logged in with an MLB account that is entitled for MLB.TV and MLB Audio
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and sees their MLB account at the top of the screen
custom_expected: Then the user will see "MLB.TV/MLB Audio" next to the account

title: Entitlements - MLB Audio
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is logged in with an MLB account that is only entitled for MLB Audio
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and sees their MLB account at the top of the screen
custom_expected: Then the user will see "MLB Audio" next to the account

title: Entitlements - Single Team
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is logged in with an MLB account that is entitled with a Single Team TV package
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and sees their MLB account at the top of the screen
custom_expected: Then the user will see "MLB.TV [Team]" next to the account

title: Entitlements - Free
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is logged in with an MLB account that has no entitlements
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and sees their MLB account at the top of the screen
custom_expected: Then the user will see "Free" next to the account

title: Entitlements - Anonymous
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user has completed an in-app purchase
but has not yet linked their purchase, and remains anonymous in the app
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and sees the My Account section at the top of the screen
custom_expected: Then the user will see options for "My Teams" and to "Connect Purchase to MLB.com"

title: Log Out Button
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is logged in with an MLB account
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Account Settings screen
and scrolls to the bottom
custom_expected: Then the user will see an option to Log Out

title: Logging Out
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is logged in with an MLB account
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Account Settings screen
and scrolls to the bottom
and taps on "Log Out"
custom_expected:
Then the Account Settings screen will refresh
and the user will no longer be logged in
and their account information will no longer be displayed atop the screen
and instead they will see options to "Log In" and "Create MLB Account"

title: Logged Out
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is not logged in with any MLB account
custom_steps: When the user opens the Account Settings screen
custom_expected: Then the user will see options at the top of the screen for "Log In" and "Create MLB Account"

title: Log In Button
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is not logged in with any MLB account
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and taps on the "Log In" option at the top of the screen
custom_expected: Then the user will be able to log in with an existing MLB account

title: Logging In via Settings
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is not logged in with any MLB account
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and taps on the "Log In" option at the top of the screen
and logs in with an existing MLB account
custom_expected:
Then the user will be brought back to the Account Settings screen
and will see their account and entitlement information

title: Create MLB Account
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is not logged in with any MLB account
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and taps on the "Create MLB Account" option at the top of the screen
custom_expected: Then the user will be able to sign up with a new MLB account

title: Create MLB Account - Valid Account
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is not logged in with any MLB account
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and taps on the "Create MLB Account" option at the top of the screen
and successfully creates a new MLB account
custom_expected:
Then the user will be brought back to the Account Settings screen
and will see their account and entitlement info

title: About the MLB app
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and scrolls to the bottom
custom_expected: Then there will be a field for "About the MLB app"

title: Contents
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Account Settings screen
and scrolls to the bottom
and taps on "About the MLB app"
custom_expected:
Then the About the MLB app section will open
and the user will be able to find app and device information
and the option to Contact Us

title: Contact Support
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user opens the Browse Menu 
and taps to "Contact Support" (under "Help" section)
custom_expected:
Then the user will be re-directed to the MLB Help Center web page with the following fields that need to be completed:

1. Reason for Contact
2. Full Name
3. Email address
4. Phone Number
5. Subject
6. Description
7. Check box with the following disclaimer: "By submitting, I acknowledge..."
8. Submit button (in red)

title: Add password visibility toggle to Login View
custom_preconds:
* User has latest build installed
* User is currently logged out
custom_steps:
Given the user navigates to the User Login Page 
And is prompted to enter email and Password
And user enters email 
When the user is ready to enter password and begins typing
custom_expected: Then the user can toggle password visibility on LoginView

title: Password visibility toggle-> Show Password
custom_preconds:
* User has latest build installed
* User is currently logged out
custom_steps:
Given the user navigates to the User Login Page
And is prompted to enter email and Password
And the user toggles the "Show Password" option to "on"
When the user types their password
custom_expected: Then the user can see the password being typed

title: Password visibility toggle-> Don't Show Password
custom_preconds:
* User has latest build installed
* User is currently logged out
custom_steps:
Given the user navigates to the User Login Page
And is prompted to enter email and Password
And the user toggles the "Show Password" option to "off"
When the user types their password
custom_expected: Then the user will not be able to see the password being typed

title: Log In Screen
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user taps "Log In" to launch the log in screen 
either from Account Settings or from a paywall
custom_expected:
Then the log in screen will be opened
and there will be an MLB logo
entries for email address and password
Privacy Policy and Forgot Password links
a Log In button
a Sign Up link

title: Email Address
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps: When the user is on the Log In screen
custom_expected: Then the user should be able to type into the space for email address

title: Password
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps: When the user is on the "Log In" screen
custom_expected: Then the user should be able to type into the space for Password

title: Invalid Email
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Log In screen
and types in an invalid email address
and has typed something in the Password field
and taps the Log In button
custom_expected:
Then the user will not have logged in
and will get a message prompt explaining why their login was not successful

title: Invalid Password
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Log In screen
and types in an invalid password
and has typed something in the Email field
and taps the Log In button
custom_expected:
Then the user will not have logged in
and will get a message prompt explaining why their login was not successful

title: Log In Button
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Log In screen
and types in a valid email address and password
and taps the Log In button
custom_expected: Then the user will have successfully logged in

title: Account Settings
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps: When the user has logged in via the More Menu > Account Settings > Log In screen
custom_expected: Then the user will be returned to the Account Settings screen upon successful login

title: Privacy Policy
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Log In screen
and taps the link for Privacy Policy
custom_expected: Then a webview with the Privacy Policy will open

title: Forgot Password
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Log In screen
and taps the link for Forgot Password
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the Forgot Password flow

title: Submitting Email in Forgot Password Flow
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Log In screen
and taps the link for Forgot Password
and is taken to the Forgot Password flow
custom_expected: Then the user will be able to type in and submit their email address

title: Forgot Password Flow
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Log In screen
and taps the link for Forgot Password
and is taken to the Forgot Password flow
and submits their email address
custom_expected: Then the user will receive an email with a link to reset their password

title: Password Reset
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user has reset their password via the link from the email generated during the Forgot Password flow
custom_steps:
When the user returns to the app's Login screen
and uses their new password to log in
custom_expected: Then the user will successfully log in

title: Link to Register Account
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Log In screen
and taps the "New to MLB? Sign Up" link
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the Sign Up screen

title: Sign Up Screen
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Account Settings screen
and taps the "Create MLB Account" link
custom_expected:
Then Sign Up screen will open
and there will be the MLB logo
text explaining to the user that they can create an account
entries for Email, Password, Confirm Password, Birthdate
Terms of Service text and link
Sign Up button
Log In link

title: Email Address
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Sign Up screen
and taps into the Email section
custom_expected: Then the user should be able to type into the space for email address

title: Invalid Email
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Sign Up screen
and fills in an invalid email address
custom_expected:
Then there will be a red X in the text field 
and the Sign Up button will be greyed out and not be available to be tapped

title: Valid Email
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Sign Up screen
and fills in a valid email address
custom_expected: Then the red X in the text field will become a green check mark

title: Password
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Sign Up screen
and taps into the Password section
custom_expected:
Then the user should be able to type into the space for password

(please do not enter a generic/easy to guess password)

title: Invalid Password
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Sign Up screen
and fills in an invalid password that doesn't satisfy the password requirements
custom_expected:
Then there will be a red X in the text field 
and the Sign Up button will be greyed out and not be available to be tapped

title: Valid Password
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Sign Up screen
and fills in a valid password that satisfies the password requirements
custom_expected: Then the red X in the text field will become a green check mark

title: Confirm Password
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Sign Up screen
and taps on the Confirm Password section
custom_expected: Then the user should be able to type into the space for confirm password

title: Passwords Don't Match
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Sign Up screen
and fills in a valid password in the Password text field
and fills in a password that doesn't match in the Confirm Password text field
custom_expected:
Then there will be a red X in the Confirm Password text field 
and the Sign Up button will be greyed out and not be available to be tapped

title: Passwords Match
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Sign Up screen
and fills in a valid password in the Password text field
and fills in a password that matches in the Confirm Password text field
custom_expected: Then the red X in the text field will become a green check mark

title: Birthdate Toggle
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed on an iOS 14 or higher device
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Sign Up screen
and views the birthdate field
custom_expected:
Then there will be a toggle in the Birthdate field 
and it will be toggled off by default

title: Birthdate
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed on an iOS 14 or higher device
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Sign Up screen
and enables the toggle in the Birthdate field
custom_expected:
Then a calendar will open
and the user will be able to choose their birthday
if the user is at least 13 years old

title: Sign Up Button
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Sign Up screen
and fills in a valid email address
and the passwords match 
and a valid birthdate
custom_expected: Then the Sign up button will become tappable

title: Signing Up
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Sign Up screen
and the Sign Up button has become tappable
and the user taps on it
custom_expected: Then the user will have successfully created a new account

title: Birthdate Confirmation
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user has successfully created a new account via the MLB app Sign Up screen
custom_steps:
When the user logs in with their new account credentials on MLB.com
and opens their Account Settings
custom_expected: Then the user's birthdate information will be available on the web's account settings screen

title: Newsletter Opt-In
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is on the Sign Up screen
and fills in a valid email address
and the passwords match
and a valid birthdate
custom_steps:
When the user unchecks the newsletter opt-in
and taps to Sign Up
custom_expected: Then the user should be able to successfully sign up

title: Newsletter Confirmation
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is on the Sign Up screen
and fills in a valid email address
and the passwords match
and a valid birthdate
custom_steps:
When the user unchecks the newsletter opt-in
and taps to Sign Up
and then logs in with their account credentials on MLB.com
and opens their Account Settings
custom_expected: Then the user should not be subscribed to receive any type of newsletter emails

title: Free Game of the Day Flow
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user does not have any entitlements
custom_steps:
When the user navs to the MLB.TV EPG
and taps to launch a Free Game of the Day
custom_expected:
Then the user will be prompted with the login screen 
explaining their account login or register options
with a link to Sign Up

title: Account Settings
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps: When the user has created a new account via the More Menu > Account Settings > Create MLB Account screen
custom_expected: Then the user will be returned to the Account Settings screen upon successful account creation

title: Terms of Service
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Sign Up screen
and taps the link for Terms of Service
custom_expected: Then a webview will open with the Terms of Service

title: Privacy Policy
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Sign Up screen
and taps the link for Privacy Policy
custom_expected: Then a webview with the Privacy Policy will open

title: Log In Link
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Sign Up screen
and taps the link for Log In
custom_expected: Then the Log In screen will open

title: Log In
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user has shared keychain enabled in their iCloud
and has previously logged in to the MLB app or other MLB properties
but is currently logged OUT of the MLB app
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Account Settings page
and taps Log In
custom_expected:
Then a screen will appear with the following:

the MLB logo up top
the email address associated with the MLB account in their shared keychain
a "Continue with MLB" button below the email address
link to Log In with another MLB account
link to Sign Up with a new account

title: Log In with another MLB account
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user has shared keychain enabled in their iCloud
and has previously logged in to the MLB app or other MLB properties
but is currently logged OUT of the MLB app
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Account Settings page
and taps Log In
and is viewing the screen with the "Continue with MLB" button 
and taps "Log in with another MLB account"
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the Log In screen

title: Sign Up Link
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user has shared keychain enabled in their iCloud
and has previously logged in to the MLB app or other MLB properties
but is currently logged OUT of the MLB app
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Account Settings page
and taps Log In
and is viewing the screen with the "Continue with MLB" button 
and taps "Don't have an account? Sign Up"
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the Sign Up screen

title: Continue with MLB
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user has shared keychain enabled in their iCloud
and has previously logged in to the MLB app or other MLB properties
but is currently logged OUT of the MLB app
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Account Settings page
and taps Log In
and is viewing the screen with the "Continue with MLB" button 
and taps "Continue with MLB"
custom_expected: Then the user will automatically be logged in with that account

title: Log In with another MLB account
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user has shared keychain enabled in their iCloud
and has previously logged in to the MLB app or other MLB properties

custom_steps:
When the user is on the Account Settings page

title: Sign Up Link
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user has shared keychain enabled in their iCloud
and has previously logged in to the MLB app or other MLB properties

custom_steps:
When the user is on the Account Settings page

title: Continue with MLB
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user has shared keychain enabled in their iCloud
and has previously logged in to the MLB app or other MLB properties
but is currently logged OUT of the MLB app
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Account Settings page
and taps Create MLB Account"
and is viewing the screen with the "Continue with MLB" button 
and taps "Continue with MLB"
custom_expected: Then the user will automatically be logged in with that account

title: Different Apps on Same Device
custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed
and another MLB product is installed on the same device
custom_steps:
When the user successfully logs in to the MLB app
and then opens another MLB product on the same device
custom_expected:
Then the credentials will be added to the shared keychain
and will be accessible in the other MLB product

title: Separate Device with iCloud
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed on one device
and another MLB product is installed on another device
and both devices are logged in with the same iCloud account
custom_steps:
When the user successfully logs in to the MLB app
and then launches another MLB product on the other device
custom_expected:
Then the credentials will be added to the shared keychain
and will be accessible in the other MLB product

title: Separate Device with iCloud - iCloud Sharing Disabled
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed on one device
and another MLB product is installed on another device
and both devices are logged in with the same iCloud account
but the user has iCloud sharing DISABLED
custom_steps:
When the user successfully logs in to the MLB app
and then launches another MLB product on the other device
custom_expected:
Then the credentials will be added to the shared keychain
and will NOT be accessible in the other MLB product

title: Shared Credentials After Logging Out of MLB App
custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed
and another MLB product is installed on the same device
and the user has previously logged in to the MLB app
custom_steps:
When the user logs out of the MLB app
and then opens another MLB product on the same device
custom_expected:
Then the credentials will be remain in the shared keychain
and will still be accessible in the other MLB product

title: Shared Credentials After Uninstalling MLB App
custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed
and another MLB product is installed on the same device
and the user has previously logged in to the MLB app
custom_steps:
When the user uninstalls the MLB app
and then opens another MLB product on the same device
custom_expected:
Then the credentials will be remain in the shared keychain
and will still be accessible in the other MLB product

title: Saved Web Credentials
custom_preconds:
Given the user has MLB app installed
and device Settings -> Passwords and  Accounts -> AutoFill Passwords ENABLED
custom_steps:
When the user logs in to MLB.com in iOS Safari 
and saves their password for the site
and then navs to the Log In screen in the MLB app
custom_expected: Then the user will be prompted to login and then can successfully login to the MLB app using the shared credentials

title: Apple Account Deletion (Logged In)
custom_preconds:
* Given the MLB app is installed
* And the user has the user has created a test account that can be closed
* And the user is logged in with account
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to Account Settings
And clicks "Close Account"
custom_expected: Then the user should be brought to a webpage for account closure (https://www.mlb.com/app/atbat/login?redirectUri=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mlb.com%2Fapp%2Fatbat%2Faccount%2Frequest-deletion)

title: Apple Account Deletion (Not Logged In)
custom_preconds:
* Given the MLB app is installed
* And the user is not logged in
custom_steps: When the user navigates to Account Settings
custom_expected: Then the user will NOT see an Account Closure option
